20.str2: A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.

20.str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A begetter, father; plur: parents. From the base of ginomai; a parent.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
For. A primary particle; properly, assigning a reason.

20.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
20.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
Acceptable, well-pleasing (especially to God), grateful. From eu and arestos; fully agreeable.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

21.str2: Father, (Heavenly) Father, ancestor, elder, senior. Apparently a primary word; a 'father'.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.

21.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: To stir up, arouse to anger, provoke, irritate, incite. From a presumed prolonged form of eris; to stimulate.

21.parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive 2nd Person Plural
21.str2: You. The person pronoun of the second person singular; thou.
A child, descendent, inhabitant. From the base of timoria; a child.
In order that, so that. Probably from the same as the former part of heautou; in order that.

21.parse: Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 3rd Person Plural
21.str2: To lose heart, be despondent, be disheartened. From a compound of a and thumos; to be spiritless, i.e. Disheartened.

22.str2: (a) (as adj.) enslaved, (b) (as noun) a (male) slave. From deo; a slave.

22.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
22.str2: From hupo and akouo; to hear under, i.e. To listen attentively; by implication, to heed or conform to a command or authority.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
A primary particle; down, in varied relations (genitive, dative or accusative) with which it is joined).
All, the whole, every kind of. Including all the forms of declension; apparently a primary word; all, any, every, the whole.
Not, lest. A primary particle of qualified negation; not, lest; also (whereas ou expects an affirmative one) whether.
From anthropos and aresko; man-courting, i.e. Fawning.
From ophthalmos and douleia; sight-labor, i.e. That needs watching.
But, except, however. Neuter plural of allos; properly, other things, i.e. contrariwise.
In, on, among. A primary preposition denoting position, and instrumentality, i.e. A relation of rest; 'in, ' at, on, by, etc.
Simplicity, sincerity, purity, graciousness. From haplous; singleness, i.e. sincerity, or generosity.
Prolonged from a primary kar; the heart, i.e. the thoughts or feelings; also the middle.

22.parse: Verb - Present Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Plural
22.str2: From phobos; to frighten, i.e. to be alarmed; by analogy, to be in awe of, i.e. Revere.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.

23.parse: Personal / Relative Pronoun - Accusative Neuter Singular
Verb - Present Subjunctive Active - 2nd Person Plural
23.str2: (a) I make, manufacture, construct, (b) I do, act, cause. Apparently a prolonged form of an obsolete primary; to make or do.

23.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Middle or Passive - 2nd Person Plural
23.str2: To work, trade, perform, do, practice, commit, acquire by labor.
From psucho; breath, i.e. spirit, abstractly or concretely.
Probably adverb of comparative from hos; which how, i.e. In that manner.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
A man, one of the human race. From aner and ops; man-faced, i.e. A human being.

24.parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Plural

24.str2: Neuter of hostis as conjunction; demonstrative, that; causative, because.

24.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 2nd Person Plural
24.str2: From apo and lambano; to receive; also to take aside.
From kleronomos; heirship, i.e. a patrimony or a possession.
From, away from. A primary particle; 'off, ' i.e. Away, in various senses.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
A reward, recompense. From antapodidomi; requital.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.
Lord, master, sir; the Lord. From kuros; supreme in authority, i.e. controller; by implication, Master.
Anointed One; the Messiah, the Christ. From chrio; Anointed One, i.e. The Messiah, an epithet of Jesus.

24.parse: Verb - Present Imperative Active - 2nd Person Plural
24.str2: To be a slave, be subject to, obey, be devoted. From doulos; to be a slave to.

25.str2: The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

25.parse: Verb - Present Participle Active - Nominative Masculine Singular
25.str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.

25.parse: Verb - Future Indicative Middle - 3rd Person Singular
25.str2: From a primary komeo; properly, to provide for, i.e. to carry off.

25.parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
25.str2: To act unjustly towards, injure, harm. From adikos; to be unjust, i.e. do wrong.

25.parse: Verb - Present Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
25.str2: I am, exist. The first person singular present indicative; a prolonged form of a primary and defective verb; I exist.
No, not. Also ouk, and ouch a primary word; the absolute negative adverb; no or not.
Partiality, favoritism. From prosopoleptes; partiality, i.e. Favoritism.
